articles.title: New chief of China's HK liaison office hopes city returns to 'right path'
articles.description: The new head of China's liaison office in Hong Kong, the most senior mainland official based in the territory, said on Monday China was the strongest backer of the Asian financial hub, which he hoped would return to "the right path".
articles.content:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - The new head of China’s liaison office in Hong Kong, the most senior mainland official based in the territory, said on Monday China was the strongest backer of the Asian financial hub, which he hoped would return to “the right path”.

articles.title: BOJ's Kuroda says will guide policy carefully with eye on Iran tensions
articles.description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda said on Monday the central bank would conduct monetary policy "carefully" while scrutinising overseas economic risks, such as escalating tensions between the United States and Iran.

articles.title: Cricket-Australia declare second innings, New Zealand chase 416
articles.description: Australia declared their second inning closed on 217 for two an hour after lunch on the fourth day of the third and final test on Monday, presenting New Zealand with an unlikely victory target of 416.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Australia declared their second inning closed on 217 for two an hour after lunch on the fourth day of the third and final test on Monday, presenting New Zealand with an unlikely victory target of 416.

articles.title: U.S. condemns move by Venezuela's ruling party to seize Congress
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo denounced on Sunday a move by Venezuela's ruling Socialist party to install a new head of Congress after armed troops blocked opposition legislators, including their leader Juan Guaido, from entering parliament.

articles.description: Ellen DeGeneres, the stand-up comedian who broke barriers to gays to become one of the most popular people on television, received a Golden Globes lifetime achievement award on Sunday.
articles.content:
BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. (Reuters) - Ellen DeGeneres, the stand-up comedian who broke barriers to gays to become one of the most popular people on television, received a Golden Globes lifetime achievement award on Sunday.

articles.title: Oil surges again after Trump threatens Iraq sanctions, Iran retaliation
articles.description: Oil prices shot more than 2% higher on Monday, with Brent rising above $70 a barrel, after U.S. President Donald Trump issued a threat to impose sanctions on Iraq amid escalating tensions with Iran in the Middle East.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Oil prices shot more than 2% higher on Monday, with Brent rising above $70 a barrel, after U.S. President Donald Trump issued a threat to impose sanctions on Iraq amid escalating tensions with Iran in the Middle East.

articles.title: Nikkei drops to 1-month low on U.S.-Iran jitters

articles.title: China's services sector expands at slower pace in December as confidence dips - Caixin PMI
articles.description: China's services sector expanded at a slower pace in December following a strong rebound in the previous month, with business confidence falling to the second lowest on record despite a pick-up in new orders, a private survey showed on Monday.

articles.title: Mexico urges Venezuela to democratically elect leadership of national assembly
articles.description: Mexico's foreign ministry on Sunday urged Venezuela to allow the leadership of the National Assembly to be democratically elected in accordance with the constitution.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico’s foreign ministry on Sunday urged Venezuela to allow the leadership of the National Assembly to be democratically elected in accordance with the constitution.

articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump spoke with U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Sunday, discussing the current situation in Iraq and Iran, the White House said in a statement.

articles.title: Thousands march in New York City against anti-Semitism in wake of attacks
articles.description: Thousands marched over the Brooklyn Bridge in New York City on Sunday in a show of solidarity with the area's Jewish community following a spate of anti-Semitic violence in recent weeks, including the stabbing attack on Hanukkah celebrants at a rabbi's home.
